entries.label: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
The Dadra And Nagar Haveli And Daman And Diu
Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
Ministry Of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises
Ministry of Fisheries,Animal Husbandry and Dairying
Ministry Of New and Renewable Energy
Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology
Ministry of Women and Child Development
Ministry Of Skill Development And Entrepreneurship
Ministry Of Personnel, Public Grievances And Pensions
Ministry Of Petroleum and Natural Gas
Comptroller And Auditor General Of India
Ministry Of Environment,forests and climate change
Ministry Of Consumer Affairs, Food And Public Distribution
Ministry Of Development Of North Eastern Region
Ministry Of Statistics and Programme Implementation
NITI Aayog (National Institution for Transforming India)

fields.schemeName: Pashudhan Mitra Scheme
fields.briefDescription: Launched on 20th June 2013, the scheme "Pashudhan Mitra Scheme1" by the Animal Husbandry Department, Govt of Chhattisgarh, aims to expand veterinary and breeding services, strengthen service delivery, and provide incentive honorariums to Pashudhan Mitras for livelihood support.

fields.schemeName: Training Assistance for Competitive Examinations
fields.briefDescription: The "Training Assistance for Competitive Examinations" scheme provides financial assistance to non-reserved category students who are undergoing training in recognized institutions for competitive recruitment examinations.

fields.schemeName: Food Bill Assistance
fields.briefDescription: The "Food Bill Assistance" scheme provides financial support to non-reserved category students pursuing graduate-level medical, dental, technical, and para-medical courses.

fields.schemeName: Rajiv Gandhi National Fellowship For Scheduled Caste Candidates
fields.briefDescription: The Rajiv Gandhi National Fellowship (RGNF) Scheme for Scheduled Caste is formulated and funded by the Ministry of Social Justice &Empowerment. The scheme is open to candidates who belong to Scheduled Caste and are pursuing higher studies such as regular and full-time M.Phil.and Ph.D.degrees.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
fields.schemeName: ICAR Emeritus Scientist
fields.briefDescription: The ICAR Emeritus Scientist Scheme is a structural method of tapping the Brain and skill bank of the outstanding superannuated professionals of NARS by allowing them to complete the work in hand for its fruitful conclusion, and utilize their talent in teaching specialized courses.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: Top Class Education For Scheduled Caste Students
fields.briefDescription: A scholarship scheme by Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment for Scheduled Caste students pursuing studies beyond class 12th admitted in a full-time course in one of the notified institutions. The total annual family income from all sources must be less than or equal to Rs. 8.00 lakh.

fields.schemeName: RMEWF-Financial Assistance To 100% Disabled Child Of Ex-Servicemen
fields.briefDescription: A scheme to provide financial assistance to Ex-Servicemen or their widows for their 100% disabled child.

fields.schemeName: RMEWF-Financial Assistance For Vocational Training Of Widows Of Ex-Servicemen
fields.briefDescription: A scheme to provide financial assistance to a widow of Ex-Servicemen to settle in life through vocational training.

fields.schemeName: Emeritus Fellowship
fields.briefDescription: A fellowship scheme by University Grants Commission to provide an opportunity to superannuated teachers to pursue active research in their respective field of specialization in Indian Universities/Colleges/ Institutions.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises
fields.schemeName: Coir Vikas Yojana-Skill Upgradation and Mahila Coir Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Skill Upgradation and Mahila Coir Yojana” is a component of “Coir Vikas Yojana” and the scheme was launched by the Ministry of Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises, Government of India.

fields.schemeName: Women Scientist Scheme-C
fields.briefDescription: A scheme by MoST for female candidates with a break in their career interested in addressing societal challenges through viable S&T interventions. 1-year training is provided in Intellectual Property Rights (IPRs), patent search, know-how, drafting, filing, trademarks, trade secrets, and copyright.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance as Shagun in Marriage of Man Workers or Son of Workers - Haryana Labour Welfare Board
fields.briefDescription: This scheme was started by the Haryana Labour Welfare Board (HLWB), Labour Department, Government of Haryana on 15.01.2019. Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹21,000/- will be provided as Shagun for the marriage of workers' sons and unmarried male workers themselves.

fields.schemeName: Mahila Samiriddhi Yojana for Minority Community
fields.briefDescription: The scheme is implemented by the Haryana Backward Classes & Economically Weaker Sections Kalyan Nigam. Under this scheme, loans up to ₹1,00,000/- per beneficiary are provided only to women entrepreneurs of the target group, either directly or through Self-Help Groups.

fields.schemeName: Marriage Assistance - Folk Artist
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Marriage Assistance" was launched by the Art and Culture Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. This scheme provides financial assistance for the marriage of registered folk artists, or their son or daughter. The assistance aims to support the cultural community by helping with marriage.

fields.schemeName: Pre Matric Scholarship For Minorities
fields.briefDescription: A scholarship scheme by Ministry of Minority Affairs for students from minority communities studying in Class 1st to Class 10th in India in a government or private school, including such residential Government institutes and eligible private institutes selected and notified in a transparent manner.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: Construction of Hostels for OBC Boys and Girls
fields.briefDescription: The Scheme aims at providing hostel facilities to students belonging to socially and educationally backward classes, especially from rural areas, to enable them to pursue secondary and higher education.

fields.schemeName: Scheme to Provide Assistance for Setting Up Farmer Support Centers in State Market Committees and for Computerization of All Market Committees
fields.briefDescription: This scheme has been introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat. It aims to establish farmer support centers at market committee levels and computerize all market committees in Gujarat.

fields.schemeName: Package for strengthening to sugar co-operatives as may be policy decided by the State Government
fields.briefDescription: This scheme has been introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat. It aims to support sugar co-operatives by providing financial assistance for modernization, diversification, organic fertilizer production to enhance sugarcane farming and the sugar industry.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Mahila Udyami Yojana
fields.briefDescription: This is a flagship scheme of the Bihar government aimed at promoting entrepreneurship and self-employment among the youth by providing financial assistance of up to ₹10,00,000/- for setting up businesses.

beneficiaryState: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
fields.schemeName: Investment Promotion Scheme (IPS) For Cottage Industries: Financial Assistance To Cottage Industries
fields.briefDescription: “Financial Assistance To Cottage Industries'' under the “Investment Promotion Scheme (IPS)”, implemented by the Dept. of Industries, U.T. Administration Of DNH & DD, aims to provide financial assistance to Cottage Industries on the term loan taken through banks.

beneficiaryState: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
fields.schemeName: Investment Promotion Scheme (IPS) for MSME Sector: Assistance For Quality Certification
fields.briefDescription: “Assistance of Interest Subsidy” under the “Investment Promotion Scheme (IPS)” for MSME sector, implemented by the Dept. of Industries, U.T. Administration Of DNH & DD,  aims to extend support to MSME to get quality certification to introduce quality products in competitive markets.

beneficiaryState: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
fields.schemeName: Investment Promotion Scheme (IPS) for MSME Sector: Reimbursement Of Free On Board (FOB) Expenses
fields.briefDescription: “Reimbursement Of Free On Board (FOB) Expenses” under the “Investment Promotion Scheme (IPS)” for MSME sector, implemented by the Dept. of Industries, U.T. Administration Of DNH & DD, aims for boosting exports in the Food/ Marine Food Processing Sector.

beneficiaryState: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance for Education for the Construction Workers
fields.briefDescription: The "Financial Assistance for Education for the Construction Workers'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department,  U.T. Administration of DNH & DD, is a welfare scheme that provides reimbursement for education of up to two children of the members.

beneficiaryState: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
fields.schemeName: Investment Promotion Scheme (IPS) for Thrust Sectors: Scheme For Marine Products Processing Units
fields.briefDescription: “Scheme For Marine Products Processing Units'' under the “Investment Promotion Scheme (IPS)” for Thrust Sectors, implemented by the Dept. of Industries, U.T. Administration of DNH & DD, aims to provide Interest Subsidy to the Establishment /Expansion of Marine products processing industries.

beneficiaryState: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
fields.schemeName: Insurance Scheme for the Construction Workers
fields.briefDescription: The "Insurance Scheme for the Construction Workers'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department,  U.T. Administration of DNH & DD, is a welfare scheme through which beneficiaries shall be enrolled under the “Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojna” and “Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojna”.

beneficiaryState: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
fields.schemeName: Shram Yogi Prasad Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The "Shram Yogi Prasad Scheme'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department, U.T. Administration of DNH & DD, is a welfare scheme that provides mid day meal and breakfast to the BOCW registered construction workers.

beneficiaryState: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
fields.schemeName: Investment Promotion Scheme (IPS) for Thrust Sectors: Assistance For Furniture Sector
fields.briefDescription: “Assistance For Furniture Sector” under the “Investment Promotion Scheme (IPS)” for Thrust Sectors, implemented by the Dept. of Industries, U.T. Administration Of DNH & DD, aims to promote Furniture industries through providing various types of subsidy.

fields.schemeName: Savitribai Phule Scholarship For V.J.N.T And S.B.C Girls Students Studying In 8th To 10 Std
fields.briefDescription: Savitribai Phule Scholarship is a Scholarship Scheme by the Social Justice and Special Assistance Department, Govt. of Maharashtra, to encourage enrollment and to decrease the dropout ratio of Girls in education.

fields.schemeName: Incentive To Owners Of Artificial Insemination Born Female Calf Through Pure Breeding In Indigenous Cow
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Incentive to Owners of Artificial Insemination Born Female Calf through Pure Breeding in Indigenous Cow” was started by the Department of Agriculture, Farmers Welfare & Co-operation, Government of Gujarat.

fields.schemeName: Girl Students Health & Hygiene Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Girl Students Health & Hygiene Scheme” was announced by the Department of School Education, Govt. of Arunachal Pradesh in 2013 for the girl students studying in classes 6-12. The scheme's focus was to retain, maintain hygiene, and continue education throughout the year.

fields.schemeName: Subsidy Scheme For Establishment Of Goat Unit (10+1) For Scheduled Tribe Women
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Subsidy Scheme for Establishment of Goat Unit (10+1) for Scheduled Tribe Women” was launched by the Department of Agriculture, Farmers Welfare & Co-operation, Government of Gujarat to uplift Economically poor livestock breeders of Gujarat State.

fields.schemeName: Mahila Kamgar Kaushal Unnayan Evan Theka Shramik, Hamaal Tatha Ghareloo Mahila Kamgaar Parivar Sashaktikaran Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Chhattisgarh State Government started a scheme "Mahila Kamgar Kaushal Unnayan Evan Theka Shramik, Hamaal Tatha Ghareloo Mahila Kamgaar Parivar Sashaktikaran Yojana" for unorganized worker on 11 March 2015.

fields.schemeName: Maternity Benefit/Delivery Assistance (K.B.O.C.W.W.B)
fields.briefDescription: The "Maternity Benefit/Delivery Assistance'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Department of Labour, Karnataka, is a welfare scheme that provides financial assistance to registered women construction workers for the birth of upto two (2) children.

fields.schemeName: Marriage Incentive Reward Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The Marriage Incentive Reward scheme for the marriage of disabled persons by the Government of Uttar Pradesh is being operated by the department since the year 1997.

fields.schemeName: Marriage Grant Scheme
fields.briefDescription: In Uttar Pradesh State, a scheme for the marriage of girls from economically weaker families of the state.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry of Fisheries,Animal Husbandry and Dairying
fields.schemeName: National Livestock Mission: Promotion of Piggery Entrepreneur
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to promote entrepreneurship in pig farming by providing a one-time capital subsidy of up to ₹30 lakh to eligible entrepreneurs and organizations to establish breeder farms.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry of Fisheries,Animal Husbandry and Dairying
fields.schemeName: National Livestock Mission: Genetic Improvement of Pig breeds - Establishment of Pig Semen Collection and Processing Lab
fields.briefDescription: The Scheme aims to enhance per-animal productivity, reduce inbreeding, and minimize sexually transmitted diseases in pigs. Through this scheme, financial assistance is provided for establishing semen processing labs at government pig farms.

fields.schemeName: Scheme of Providing Assistance to Encourage Farmers for Adoption of Organic Farming
fields.briefDescription: This scheme has been introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Dept., Gujarat. It aims to promote organic farming by providing financial assistance to farmers for certification, input subsidies, and residue testing.

fields.schemeName: Scholarship For Transgender Students
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Scholarship for Transgender Students” was launched by the Social Justice Department, Government of Kerala for providing scholarships to Transgender students from 7th standard onwards studying in State Government/ Government aided/ Self Financing schools.

fields.schemeName: Marriage Assistance To Daughters Of Differently Abled Parents (Parinayam-I)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Marriage Assistance to Daughters of Differently Abled Parents (Parinayam-I)” was launched by the Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala.

fields.schemeName: Marriage Assistance For Legally Married Transgender Couples
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Marriage Assistance for Legally Married Transgender Couples” was launched by the Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala. This scheme is intended to help deprived transgender individuals who are planning to get married legally to lead a steady normal family life.

fields.schemeName: Incentive To Girls
fields.briefDescription: Rajasthan State started a scheme "Incentive for Girls" for state students.

fields.schemeName: Aapki Beti Hamari Beti
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Aapki Beti Hamari Beti” was launched by the Department of Women and Child Development, Government of Haryana on 24th August 2015.

fields.schemeName: BSR Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The Research Fellowship in Sciences for meritorious students BSR scheme of the UGC is open to candidates who are selected for registering for the Ph.D. program of the university through a procedure outlined already in the UGC notification by a regular admission procedure.

fields.schemeName: National Awards to Teachers
fields.briefDescription: "National Awards to Teachers" aims to celebrate the contributions of outstanding teachers and enhance the quality of school education. This award provides public recognition and honours the commitment of teachers, benefiting meritorious teachers working in primary, middle, and secondary schools.

fields.schemeName: Scholarship for Children of Ex-Servicemen for Vocational and Technical Education
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, a scholarship of ₹15,000 per year is provided to the children of ex-servicemen, from the rank of Sepoy to Havildar, who are pursuing vocational & technical education & have not received scholarship assistance under the Prime Minister's Scholarship Scheme or from any other source.

fields.schemeName: West Bengal Incentive Scheme for Approved Industrial Park (SAIP) for MSMEs: Incentive for Basic and Essential Common Infrastructure Facilities
fields.briefDescription: The “Incentive for Basic and Essential Common Infrastructure Facilities” under the “SAIP for MSMEs” scheme, aims to provide one time back-ended incentive for development of Basic and Essential Common Infrastructure Facilities based on land area.

fields.schemeName: Establishment of 12 Milch Animal Farm
fields.briefDescription: The "Establishment of 12 Milch Animal Farm" scheme introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, supports livestock owners in establishing dairy farms with up to 12 milch animals.

fields.schemeName: West Bengal Incentive Scheme for Approved Industrial Park (SAIP) for MSMEs: Incentive for Setting up a Power Sub Station
fields.briefDescription: The “Incentive for Setting up a Power Sub Station” under the “SAIP for MSMEs” scheme, facilitates the Private Industrial Park in the provision of quality power.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance to SC Students for Pursuing Higher Studies Abroad
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to support SC students for higher education abroad in fields like Engineering, Sciences, and Humanities. Benefits include up to ₹20,00,000/- for Ph.D. and ₹10,00,000 for Masters, with eligibility criteria including residency and income below ₹8,00,000/-.

fields.schemeName: Coconut Development Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The "Coconut Development Scheme" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to support farmers by providing quality coconut saplings and financial assistance for coconut cultivation.

fields.schemeName: Bidya Lakshmi Loan
fields.briefDescription: "Bidya Lakshmi" aims to provide education loans for higher studies to children of Assam State Government employees. Benefits include loans up to ₹10,00,000/- at 4% interest, with subsidies for eligible candidates.

fields.schemeName: Incentive to Owners of A.I. Born Female Calf through Pure Breeding in Indigenous Cow Across the State
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to support livestock owners in maintaining and increasing the population of indigenous cattle breeds like Gir and Kankrej.

fields.schemeName: Sishu Saathi
fields.briefDescription: “Sishu Saathi”, a scheme of the Health and Family Welfare Department, Government of West Bengal as part of the Rastriya Bal Swasthya Karyakram (RBSK) under National Health Mission is meant to treat Indian children of 0-18 years age group with zero out of pocket expenditure.

fields.schemeName: Krishak Bandhu Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide financial security to farmers through direct income support and death/disability benefits. It benefits small and marginal farmers with annual assistance of ₹5,000/- per acre and a one-time payout of ₹2,00,000/- in case of death.

fields.schemeName: Mahtari Vandan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to eliminate discrimination and inequality against women, improve their health and nutrition, promote economic independence and empowerment, and strengthen their decision-making role in the family.  It offers financial assistance to eligible married women to support their well-being.

fields.schemeName: Free Supply of Text Books
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides textbooks or cash subsidies for textbooks and writing materials to students of Government and Aided Schools. Benefits include financial assistance ranging from ₹550/- to ₹830/- per annum, with additional support for geometry boxes. All students from Nursery to 12th are eligible.

fields.schemeName: Supply of Fodder Minikit
fields.briefDescription: The "Supply of Fodder Minikit" scheme introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to provide improved varieties of fodder seeds to farmers.

fields.schemeName: Tiatr Script Writing Workshop
fields.briefDescription: The scheme's objective is to enrich and promote the writing skills of Tiatr playwrights and to have a healthy and constructive discussion on various aspects of Tiatr script writing amongst the Tiatr writers, participating institutions and artistes. Lunch & refreshments are provided to participants.

fields.schemeName: Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme (Punjab)
fields.briefDescription: "Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme (IGNWPS)" provides a pension of ₹300/- per month to widows aged 40 years and above. After attaining the age of 80 years, the pension amount increases to ₹500/- per month.

fields.schemeName: National Family Benefit Scheme (Punjab)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "National Family Benefit Scheme (Punjab)" by the Department of Social Security and Development of Women and Children, Government of Punjab, provides a lump sum assistance of ₹20,000/- is provided to the bereaved household in the event of the death of their breadwinner.

fields.schemeName: Merit Scholarship: Engineering University
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides ₹1000/- per month to eligible students for pursuing B.E. from a recognized engineering college in Chhattisgarh.  The applicants can either be students who have passed their 10th and 12th standard examinations, or Diploma holders newly admitted to the second year of B.E.

fields.schemeName: Merit cum Means Scholarship: Engineering University
fields.briefDescription: "Merit cum Means Scholarship: Engineering University" is a scholarship scheme by the Technical Education Department, Government of Chhattisgarh. The scheme provides ₹1,000/- per month to eligible students for pursuing education from recognized engineering universities in Chhattisgarh.

fields.schemeName: Marathi Drama Competition ‘A' & ‘B' Group
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Marathi Drama Competition 'A' & 'B' Group" is a state-level initiative by the Kala Academy, under the Department of Art and Culture, Government of Goa. It provides a platform to urban and rural theatre groups and offers transport assistance for artistes and stage material as per govt.

fields.schemeName: Bhajan Competition
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Bhajan Competition" is a Cultural scheme to preserve and promote the tradition of Bhajan singing.  Competition is organized at the Regional level and the selected group from this competition will participate at the State Level. Entries are invited through local press notes.

fields.schemeName: Assistance of Concentrate Feed After Parturition (Scheduled Tribe Category)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Assistance of Concentrate Feed After Parturition (Scheduled Tribe Category)" provides 150 kg of BIS Type II concentrate feed to Scheduled Tribe Category livestock owners after parturition to support cattle health, increase milk production, and enhance calf development.

fields.schemeName: Assistance of Concentrate Feed for Pregnant Animals (Scheduled Tribe Category)
fields.briefDescription: This scheme provides free BIS type II concentrate feed to pregnant cattle owned by Scheduled Tribe Category livestock owners in Gujarat to ensure their good health, boost immunity, prevent metabolic diseases, and enhance milk production.

fields.schemeName: Assistance for Cattleshed, Gaman, Water Tank and Bucket
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Assistance for Cattleshed, Gaman, Water Tank and Bucket" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Dept., Gujarat, aims to support livestock farmers by offering financial assistance for essential infrastructure such as cattle sheds, gaman, water tanks, and buckets.

fields.schemeName: Scheme for Management and Purchase of Bulls Provided for Breeding of State Gir/ Kankarej Breed
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides financial assistance to registered Gaushalas for rearing purebred Gir or Kankrej male cow calves with high genetic quality to promote pure breeding in indigenous cattle.

fields.schemeName: COP-34 Financial Assistance to Farmer for Interest Subvention (Kishan Credit Card Interest Asst.)
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance in the form of interest subvention is provided to farmers who repay their crop loans on time, helping them improve their agricultural productivity and economic well-being.

fields.schemeName: Anya Pichhda Varg Kalyan Chhatravaas
fields.briefDescription: The Scheme "Anya Pichhda Varg Kalyan Chhatravaas" under the BC & EBC Welfare Department, Bihar. under this scheme, provied ₹1,000/- per month hostel grant is provided for each student and 15 kg of free food grains per month (9 kg rice + 6 kg wheat).

fields.schemeName: Scheme to Give Incentive-Prize to Gaushala/ Panjrapole
fields.briefDescription: The "Scheme to Give Incentive-Prize to Gaushala/ Panjrapole" focuses on enhancing the management and operation of Gaushalas and Panjrapoles by offering incentive prizes to the top performers.

fields.schemeName: Scheme for Supply of Improved Seeds for Fodder
fields.briefDescription: The "Scheme for Supply of Improved Seeds for Fodder" aims to supply improved quality fodder seeds to registered Gaushalas and Panjarapols to ensure round-the-year green fodder availability for livestock.

fields.schemeName: Nagaland Stipend for Girls of Secondary Students
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to encourage girl students of class IX & X studying at Govt. High Schools & Govt. Higher Secondary Schools who belong to economically weaker families. Under this scheme, a stipend will be provided to two girls from each class, nominated by Headmaster/Principal of concerned school.

fields.schemeName: Hon’ble Chief Minister’s Merit Scholarship Scheme-Sikkim
fields.briefDescription: This scheme aims to provide free education up to the Graduation level to talented and deserving children from underprivileged families with an opportunity to study in reputed public schools both within and outside the state.

fields.schemeName: Free Pre-Recruitment Training
fields.briefDescription: “Free Pre-Recruitment Training” is a social security scheme that provides free of cost pre-recruitment training to the sons of the ex-servicemen for the recruitment in Army/Para-Military Forces and Police Forces.

fields.schemeName: Assistance for Cultivation of Medicinal/ Aromatic Crops
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides financial assistance up to 75% of the cost or ₹11,250/- per hectare (whichever is lower) to farmers in Gujarat cultivating medicinal or aromatic crops on land between 0.20 and 4 hectares.

fields.schemeName: Scheme to Encourage Farmers to Add Value to Crops
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides financial assistance to farmers across Gujarat in adding value to their crops by providing financial assistance for purchasing machinery.

fields.schemeName: Agro Service Provider Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The "Agro Service Provider Scheme" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, aims to support farmers by providing subsidies for acquiring agricultural implements.

fields.schemeName: Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme (Maharashtra)
fields.briefDescription: "Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme (Maharashtra)" is a scheme by the Social Justice & Special Assistance Dept, Govt of Maharashtra. In this scheme, widows aged 40 to 79 years who are from a BPL family receive a pension of ₹1500/- per month.

fields.schemeName: Skilled Youth Startup Scheme
fields.briefDescription: Sikkim Skilled Youth Startup Scheme was launched in 2020 and is implemented by the Department of Commerce & Industries which aims at assisting the educated unemployed youth in setting up a myriad of enterprises through loans with back-ended financial subsidy assistance.

fields.schemeName: Incentive Scheme for Meritorious Students of Economically Backward Class of General Category
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, a one-time financial assistance of ₹15,000/- along with a certificate of appreciation is awarded to top 100 meritorious students of Class 10 & each stream of Class 12, who are listed in state-level merit list of Rajasthan Board of Secondary Education, Ajmer.

fields.schemeName: Special Incentive Scheme for Women of Tharu, Boksa and Other Tribes (For Training and Marketing)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to empower tribal women artisans of Tharu, Boksa and Other Tribal Communities through specialized training and marketing opportunities and ensures the provision of financial assistance for travel, logistics, and stall rent for participating artisans.

fields.schemeName: ICSSR Post-Doctoral Fellowship
fields.briefDescription: The Indian Council of Social Science Research (ICSSR) offers Postdoctoral Fellowships to encourage original and quality research by young and mid-career scholars in the field of social sciences. It is designed for researchers who have just finished their Ph.D. in advanced social science research.

fields.schemeName: Chief Minister Hunar Yojana
fields.briefDescription: “Chief Minister Hunar Yojana” is a social security scheme by the Minority Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand, that provides free of cost training and stipend to the minority community to enhance their skills and knowledge.

fields.schemeName: Assistance to Pilgrims for Kailash Mansarovar Yatra - Rajasthan
fields.briefDescription: The objective of this scheme is to provide financial support to residents of Rajasthan who successfully complete the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra organized by the Ministry of External Affairs, Govt. of India. Under this scheme, each pilgrim is granted financial assistance of up to ₹1,00,000/-.

fields.schemeName: Pandit Dindayal Upadhyay Awas Yojana (Developing Caste Welfare) (NT-DNT)
fields.briefDescription: The "Pandit Dindayal Upadhyay Awas Yojana (Developing Caste Welfare) (NT-DNT)" provides financial assistance of up to ₹1,20,000/- to the people belonging to Nomadic Tribes and Denotified Tribes.

fields.schemeName: Sindhu Darshan Pilgrimage Scheme - Rajasthan
fields.briefDescription: The objective of this scheme is to provide financial assistance to pilgrims undertaking a pilgrimage to the Sindhu River in the Ladakh region of India. Under this scheme, selected beneficiaries receive reimbursement of their travel expenses, up to a maximum of ₹10,000/- per pilgrim.

fields.schemeName: Rythu Bima Scheme
fields.briefDescription: Rythu Bandhu Farmer Group Life  Insurance Scheme for Farmers” is a life insurance scheme by the Government of Telangana that provides insurance coverage to the nominee of a farmer in case of the farmer’s death. It is free for farmers and is implemented through LIC.

fields.schemeName: Passenger Vehicle/Loading Vehicle Loan Scheme (DAADC)
fields.briefDescription: The "Passenger Vehicle/Loading Vehicle Loan Scheme" introduced by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department provides financial support to unemployed individuals from Antyodaya Caste for purchasing passenger or freight vehicles.

fields.schemeName: Awarding Teleeducation Scholarships To Afghan Students
fields.briefDescription: The "Awarding Teleeducation Scholarships To Afghan Students" scheme under e-VidyaBharati Network Project, launched by the Ministry of External Affairs, offers 1000 annual scholarships to Afghan students for UGC-approved online UG and PG programs from Indian universities.

fields.schemeName: Pre-Examination Coaching Scheme
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, free coaching and monthly scholarships are provided to eligible Scheduled Tribe students appearing for exams like IAS, PCS, engineering, medical, NDA, Group ‘C’ exams and other competitive examinations.

fields.schemeName: Rani Lakshmi Bai Atma Raksha Prashikshan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The "Rani Lakshmi Bai Atma Raksha Prashikshan Yojana" provides free self-defense training to girl students studying in government upper primary and secondary schools across Uttarakhand.

fields.schemeName: Natural Death Assistance for the Construction Workers (UKBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: “Natural Death Assistance for the Construction Workers’’ is a social security scheme that provides financial assistance of ₹2,00,000/- to the nominee or dependent of a deceased registered construction worker in the event of their natural death.

fields.schemeName: Contract Khel Prashikshakon Ki Niyukti
fields.briefDescription: The scheme facilitates the annual appointment of contract-based sports trainers for conducting various local training camps across Uttarakhand, thereby promoting employment opportunities and strengthening grassroots sports infrastructure.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: Free Coaching Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide good coaching quality for DNT candidates to enable them to appear in competitive examinations and succeed in obtaining an appropriate job in the Public/Private Sector.

fields.schemeName: Dr. Bhimrao Ambedkar Sanskrit Scholarship Scheme for Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe Students
fields.briefDescription: This scheme provides financial assistance to Scheduled Caste (SC) and Scheduled Tribe (ST) students studying in Sanskrit schools from Class 6 to 12 in Uttarakhand to promote Sanskrit education among disadvantaged communities.

fields.schemeName: Pandit Dindayal Upadhyay Awas Yojana (Developing Caste Welfare) (EBC)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to support Economically Weaker Sections (EWS) by offering financial aid up to ₹1,20,000/- for house construction. This scheme also ensures that Economically Weaker Sections receive support in securing shelter.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: Niramaya Health Insurance Scheme
fields.briefDescription: Niramaya Health Insurance Scheme ,launched by the Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities, aims to provide affordable health insurance to the Persons with Disabilities (PwDs).

fields.schemeName: Sugamya Pustakalaya
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Sugamya Pustakalaya" is a unique resource providing reading material in accessible formats (Braille, audio, large print, digital, e-books) to visually impaired and print-disabled individuals across India, offering both free individual membership and paid institutional membership.
